title: ICE: could not fully normalize `&<MyType as std::ops::Index<MyType>>::Output

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code [repo github](https://github.com/ABouttefeux/sudoku-solver/tree/const-generic) Sorry I did not found a minimal code yet, I will try a bit more to find one ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0-nightly (ac50a5335 2021-08-27) binary: rustc commit-hash: ac50a53359328a5d7f2f558833e63d59d372e4f7 commit-date: 2021-08-27 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.56.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler\rustc_traits\src\normalize_erasing_regions.rs:54:32: could not fully normalize `& as std::ops::Index>>::Output` ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler\rustc_errors\src\lib.rs:1147:9 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff8f7f97ebe - ::fmt::h6b00b2712108694c 1: 0x7ff8f7fc270a - core::fmt::write::h7e004fee938dc3bd 2: 0x7ff8f7f8b388 - RtlUserThreadStart note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.0-nightly (ac50a5335 2021-08-27) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [normalize_generic_arg_after_erasing_regions] normalizing `& as std::ops::Index>>::Output` end of query stack error: could not compile `sudoku` ```
